title: EM waves - evidence that IR can travel in a vacuum

content.question: Can infrared waves propagate in a vacuum? What evidence or reasoning helps support the claim?

choices.label: Yes. Infrared waves transfer energy without transferring matter.
Yes. Infrared waves are comprised of electric and magnetic fields, which can exist in a vacuum.
No. Infrared waves require particles with kinetic energy in order for the waves to propagate.
No. Infrared waves carry electric charge, which must interact with other charged matter in order for the waves to propagate.

content.answer: Yes. Infrared waves are comprised of electric and magnetic fields, which can exist in a vacuum.
